headline: Leptospirosis in Kenya
main_text: The Ministry of Health, Kenya has reported a total number of 141 suspected cases including 6 deaths of leptospirosis in a high school in Bungoma district. Leptospirosis has been laboratory confirmed by the Kenya Medical Research Institute (KEMRI). A nearby primary school has also reported suspected cases and 2 deaths. Environment, epidemiology and laboratory teams from the Ministry of Health are working with district teams on investigations, with support from WHO. For more information: Human leptospirosis: guidance for diagnosis, surveillance and control(English pdf, 565k)
